channel.title: Which model format does Runescape use?
channel.description: Which type of model formats did Runescape use in RSC and previous RS2? Which ones are they using now?

item.title: Which model format does Runescape use?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

iirc their job postings for modelers required “a working knowledge of Softimage XSI”

Read full topic

item.title: Which model format does Runescape use?

item.source: Which model format does Runescape use?

item.title: Which model format does Runescape use?
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Tenen:

Pardon my idiotic self. I was hoping for a format they might be storing the models in (such as OBJ or XYZ). I’ve read that the new models being released are made from their own model creator. But, before they made a model creator, which format were the models being exported to?

They could use 3DS to make them but have their own custom exporter.

Read full topic
item.source: Which model format does Runescape use?

item.title: Which model format does Runescape use?
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

It’s a basic 3D compression format, nothing special, they don’t have a patent.
Old dat spec http://uppit.com/NS643H

Read full topic
item.source: Which model format does Runescape use?

item.title: Which model format does Runescape use?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

They were all made from model creators. They are in a custom format.

item.title: Which model format does Runescape use?
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

Earlier RS2 model format is still supported by current engine. There is also a new format. RSC format is like neither.[br][br][size=1]Posted on: August 14, 2009, 06:46:55 pm[/size][hr]PS if you were hoping for something like ‘OH 3DS MAX DUDE’ then you’re an idiot.

Read full topic
